decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - By reason of scale, design and location, the proposed development would constitute an unsympathetic, visually intrusive and incongruous form of development that would relate poorly to the frontage of host building and adjoining local streetscape. The proposed development would result in less than substantial harm to the character and appearance of the Battersea Park Conservation Area, for which no significant public benefits have been identified that would outweigh the harm caused to the special character and appearance of the conservation area. Accordingly, the proposals fail to conform to Section 72(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, the NPPF (2021), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021), policies PL1 and IS3 of the Wandsworth Core Strategy (2016), policies DMS1, DMS2 and DMTS9 of the Development Management Policies Document (2016),policies LP1, LP3 and LP8 of the Wandsworth Publication Version Local Plan (2023), and the guidance within the Housing SPD (2016) and Battersea Park Conservation Area Appraisal & Management Strategy (2007).

Reason : 2 - By reason of its scale and siting, the proposed development would constitute an unneighbourly and overbearing form of development that would harm the visual amenities of neighbouring residents in terms of a loss of outlook and increased sense of enclosure. Accordingly, the proposal fails to conform to policy  DMS1 of the Development Management Policies Document (2016) and policy LP2 of the Wandsworth Publication Version Local Plan (2023).

Reason : 3 - In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. We have made available detailed advice in the form of our statutory policies in the Local Plan consisting of the Core Strategy, Development Management Policies Document, Supplementary Planning documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition further guidance was offered to the applicant by the case officer during the processing of the application to identify amendments to address those elements of the scheme considered unacceptable. However, the necessary amendments to make the application acceptable are substantial and would materially change the development proposal. They would require further consultations to be undertaken prior to determination, which could not take place within the statutory determination period specified by the Department of Communities and Local Government.
